SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
COMMERCE MARKETPLACE
Commerce Marketplace for Salesforce Commerce

Connect the Commerce Marketplace app to your existing Salesforce Commerce to let third-party sellers offer their products in your Salesforce Commerce storefront for a fee. Buyers can view the products of the third-party seller and compare prices. The Commerce Marketplace app is available as a managed package that’s installed on top of Salesforce Commerce. It includes additional Marketplace entities, storefront components, and integration components. The app also offers a multi-marketplace solution for creating and managing different Marketplaces to diversify your revenue stream and increase your market share, data insights, and opportunities for cross-promotion.

Enable the Commerce Marketplace Integration
Start connecting your Salesforce Commerce storefront with the Commerce Marketplace app by setting up the page layout, record type, and user permission set.
Create a Marketplace Configuration for B2B Commerce and D2C Commerce
Connect the Marketplace app with your Salesforce Commerce store by creating a Marketplace Configuration for B2B/D2C Commerce.
Transfer Salesforce Commerce Store Data to a Commerce Marketplace App
Enable the integration and quickly transfer your Salesforce Commerce data to a Commerce Marketplace app.
Marketplace and Sellers' Shipping Costs
The Marketplace shipping costs are calculated separately and automatically added to the minimum shipping costs of all sellers.
Connect the Marketplace App to Your Storefront
To connect the Marketplace app to your store front, you have to follow a few prerequisites before enabling the apex class access to guest and authenticated users, and configuring the Lightning Web Runtime (LWR) for Marketplace.
